>> Are a collection of unit tests a clear statement of the contract? <<

I write tests by writing the categories of tests I intend to write in the
near future, then specific conditions being tested, then a specific test,
then the code. I repeat by going back up to the conditions, if there are
some untested. Then I go back up to the categories if there are some
untested, then I go back to the drawing board.

The benefit is seeing the conditions grouped and documented independent of
the code. It's fair not to consider that a benefit, but helps me get an
overview of the test code.

I posted a message to the TDD group a week ago or so explaining how I do
this in comments and can use Emacs' outline-mode to hide and show levels of
the outline. The actual code is the leaf of the branch, and I tend to have a
couple of levels of contract-like comments.

-Patrick
